testimonials.quoteTitle: HOME HEALTH CARE THERAPISTS FACILITATE INCREDIBLE JOURNEY
testimonials.quote: His physical therapist, Dale, was determined to get Mr. E out of his power chair and walking before the first hint of spring in Cleveland. Mr. E’s own goal was to be able to leave his home and eat at a restaurant under his own power. Dale made Mr. E’s goal his own goal, and together the two began an incredible journey.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Home Health Care Therapists Facilitate Incredible Journey

“You can’t imagine what it felt like to wake up in the ICU and not know where you are, what happened, and then realize that you can’t move.” While visiting his family, Mr. E had fallen down steps and sustained a spinal cord injury, a devastating injury he was unable to recall. After a long hospital stay, Mr. E was discharged from a long-term rehab facility and referred to Heartland Home Health Care Serving Northeast Ohio.

His physical therapist, Dale, was determined to get Mr. E out of his power chair and walking before the first hint of spring in Cleveland. Mr. E’s own goal was to be able to leave his home and eat at a restaurant under his own power. Dale made Mr. E’s goal his own goal, and together the two began an incredible journey.

The first step was to get Mr. E out of his chair and walking independently with a walker. Dale soon realized that underneath all that determination, Mr. E was terrified of falling. So Dale worked with Mr. E on controlled falls in a safe environment and the steps to take to get back up. Once Mr. E felt more in control, they worked on strength training and balance activities, and tackled obstacles such as navigating his home, climbing steps and getting in and out of bed. Each new success was another victory and, eventually, Dale was able to transition Mr. E to a walker.

Heidi, Mr. E’s occupational therapist, helps patients regain their ability to do small, but important tasks to be more independent in their daily lives. At the start, Mr. E was completely dependent on others for food preparation, dressing and basic hygiene responsibilities. But with Heidi’s help, he is now able to make his own lunch, dress himself and manage his own hygiene.

Dale and Heidi worked with Mr. E every week until April. To celebrate all of his accomplishments, the Heartland team took Mr. E to his favorite pizzeria. He was able to exit his home, safely get into a car and walk into the pizzeria on his own using his walker, accomplishing the goals he and his therapists had strived for.

testimonials.quoteTitle: HEARTLAND HOME HEALTH & HOSPICE DONATES TO THE UNITED WAY OF MIDLAND COUNTY’S RISE TOGETHER FUND THROUGH THE HEARTLAND HOSPICE MEMORIAL FUND
testimonials.quote: Heartland Home Health & Hospice serving Northeastern Michigan donated $10,000 to the United Way Midland County’s Rise Together Fund through the Heartland Hospice Memorial Fund.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Heartland Home Health & Hospice Donates to the United Way of Midland County’s Rise Together Fund through the Heartland Hospice Memorial Fund

Heartland Home Health & Hospice serving Northeastern Michigan donated $10,000 to the United Way Midland County’s Rise Together Fund through the Heartland Hospice Memorial Fund.

In May, two dams failed and flooded Midland causing extreme damages. Heartland Home Health & Hospice wanted to plan a fundraiser to help their community recover from the damages so the team reached out to Melanie Maraugha, Donor Relations Manager, Grants Officer with ProMedica Foundation, to find out what they could do to for a fundraiser and she informed the agency that through the Heartland Hospice Memorial Fund and ProMedica Foundation they could donate $10,000 to their community.

The Heartland Hospice Memorial Fund donation was distributed between Riverside Place of Midland, Great Lakes Bay Veterans Coalition and United Way of Midland County’s Rise Together Fund. When Heartland found out that Riverside Place of Midland had to immediately evacuate their residence due to the flooding, they felt it was important to help them with some of the donation funds. Heartland is also committed to serving Veterans in the community and is a partner with the We Honor Veterans Program. Kendall MacConnell, Veteran Volunteer, mentioned that he had volunteered with the Great Lakes Bay Veterans Coalition handing out food to those who were in need after the flood, the team knew this was an organization they also wanted to help. The Heartland team found out that the Great Lakes Bay Veterans Coalition matches their donations to help restore the homes of Veterans that were damaged by the flood. Another vital organization Heartland wanted to give to was the United Way of Midland County’s Rise Together Fund as they continue to help those affected by the flood.

Representatives from the organizations attended the check presentation that was held on July 24, 2020 at the Heartland Home Health & Hospice office. Brad, Terry and Greg from the Veterans Coalition attended and shared how they helped with evacuating local residents, set-up shelters and transported food to shelters. Ashley and Lindsay from the United Way of Midland County also attended the check presentation and were very thankful to Heartland for their donation. Kim with Riverside was unable to attend the check presentation but expressed her appreciation for the donation and the support from Heartland to help restore their facility where so many seniors call home.

“I honestly tear up trying to put into words what it means to the Heartland team to be able to support our community. We are blessed to work within an organization that truly shares our mission of serving others and with these local organizations serving those who need help the most during this natural disaster. We are so very thankful to Melanie and the Heartland Hospice Memorial Fund for helping our agency give back to others. I feel great about working for an organization that is proven to be as they claim: Helpful, Caring and Responsive!” said Julie Rousse, Administrator.

testimonials.quoteTitle: MARLA GOES ABOVE AND BEYOND EXPECTATIONS
testimonials.quote: Marla, an Account Liaison for Heartland in Bay City, MI, met with a patient to discuss the benefits of Home Health Care and what to expect from the services.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Marla Goes Above and Beyond Expectations

Dan, Director of Clinical Services in our Great Lakes Division, shares this patient story from Bay City:

Marla, an Account Liaison for Heartland Home Health and Hospice Serving Northeastern Michigan, met with a patient to discuss the benefits of Home Health Care and what to expect from the services. During their conversation, the patient shared that he was concerned about his dog since he was not able to let him outside while he was in the hospital. The patient also shared with Marla that he was having some anxiety over other personal matters.

Marla spent a lot of time with the patient and went out of her way to try to relieve some of the anxiety he was having. She asked the patient if he had anybody in mind that could check on his dog. She then contacted a friend of the patient on the patient’s behalf and asked if he would go into the home to let the dog out and check on things. Marla then followed up to make sure everything was taken care of at the patient’s home.

Thanks to Marla and the staff in Bay City for this “WOW” experience!

testimonials.quoteTitle: HOME HEALTH AND HOSPICE AGENCY AND SKILLED NURSING FACILITY PARTNER AT LOCAL EVENT TO CELEBRATE NEW NAME
testimonials.quote: ProMedica Home Health and Hospice Serving Central Ohio and ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (Westerville) recently attended a community pep rally at The Avalon of New Albany to engage with the community about the continuum of care that ProMedica provides.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Home Health and Hospice Agency and Skilled Nursing Facility Partner at Local Event to Celebrate New Name

ProMedica Home Health and Hospice Serving Central Ohio and ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (Westerville) recently attended a community pep rally at The Avalon of New Albany to engage with the community about the continuum of care that ProMedica provides. It was a fun event, filled with music, food trucks, a bounce house, a bonfire and a raffle. Residents, community members, colleagues from other healthcare organizations, as well as team members from both the agency and facility attended the event.

When asked about the purpose of the event, Katie Brown, senior account liaison at ProMedica Home Health and Hospice, shared, “It is important to collaborate because ProMedica offers a continuity of care with creative solutions to meet patients and families in their healthcare journey.”

This event provided an opportunity to share the continuum of care in the Central Ohio area and allowed the teams to engage with their community in a creative way. Even Brutus, The Ohio State University mascot, attended!

testimonials.quoteTitle: MAINTAINING INDEPENDENCE THROUGH HEARTLAND HOME HEALTH CARE
testimonials.quote: “How will I care for myself?” “Will I be able to stay in my own home?” “Who will provide the assistance I need?” Through Heartland Home Health Care, patients can get the care they need to stay independent. Heartland Home Health Serving Western Pennsylvania’s physical and occupational therapists take great care of their 90-year-old patient to make him safe and comfortable in his home.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Maintaining Independence through Heartland Home Health Care

“How will I care for myself?” “Will I be able to stay in my own home?” “Who will provide the assistance I need?” Through Heartland Home Health Care, patients can get the care they need to stay independent.  Heartland Home Health Serving Western Pennsylvania’s physical and occupational therapists take great care of their 90-year-old patient to make him safe and comfortable in his home.

“We have a patient who is 90 years old and lives alone in the city of Pittsburgh. He is very motivated to take care of himself and cooks multiple times per day. Susanne, Occupational Therapist, noticed that when he cooks items, he would often burn them due to forgetfulness. She also was concerned he would leave something on the stove and possibly start a fire. “Susanne could have simply recommended he purchase a timer, but she actually went and purchased an inexpensive timer for him, to help him avoid burning his food and to reduce the risk of any type of a fire. She also used duct tape to tape down cords that were stretched across his pathways, which were tripping hazards for him. She also assisted with his medication management, making it easier and simpler for him to correctly take the medication at the right times. “Jeff, our Physical Therapist, observed the same patient venting frustration at his medical bills, which didn’t include an “S” at the end of his last name. He said this has been an ongoing problem since he turned age 65: 25 years ago. Jeff asked to look at his Medicare card and noticed that the Medicare card was spelled incorrectly, yet his Social Security card had the correct spelling. Jeff then called both Medicare and Social Security offices and coordinated with them to change the patient’s name to be spelled correctly on his Medicare card. Medicare was sending out a corrected card within a month! This way the patient will no longer have the frustrating situation of medical bills with an incorrect last name. “The patient was extremely pleased with both of these clinicians’ extra efforts in assisting him. He stated “Susanne gave me the best gift ever, that timer! I love it and it helps me to not burn my bacon!”

testimonials.quoteTitle: HOSPICE AGENCY RELOCATES AND RECOGNIZES WORLD HOSPICE & PALLIATIVE CARE DAY
testimonials.quote: Heartland Home Health and Hospice Serving Northeast Indiana recently held a ribbon-cutting ceremony as they moved to a new building on Dupont Commerce Court in Fort Wayne, where they will continue to provide the same great home health and hospice care.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Heartland Home Health and Hospice Agency Relocates and Recognizes World Hospice & Palliative Care Day

Heartland Home Health and Hospice Serving Northeast Indiana recently held a ribbon-cutting ceremony as they moved to a new building on Dupont Commerce Court in Fort Wayne, where they will continue to provide the same great home health and hospice care. At the same ceremony, they recognized World Hospice & Palliative Day with a proclamation signed by Mayor of Fort Wayne, Tom Henry. Fort Wayne’s Deputy Mayor, Karl Bandemer, was also in attendance. When asked about the ceremony and the building, Christy Naylor, manager of business development, stated, “Our new office gives our team of over 200 employees the space they deserve to continue to provide the excellent care to our patients and their families. Additionally, this also gives our team opportunities to host much-needed support groups for our community.”

testimonials.quoteTitle: PROMEDICA HOSPICE MEMORIAL FUND AND HEARTLAND HOME HEALTH AND HOSPICE PRESENT CHECK TO PAT DYER MEMORIAL FUND
testimonials.quote: ProMedica Hospice Memorial Fund, formerly Heartland Hospice Memorial Fund, and Heartland Home Health & Hospice Serving Northeast Indiana recently presented the Pat Dyer Memorial Fund with a $1,000 check.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

ProMedica Hospice Memorial Fund and Heartland Home Health and Hospice Present Check to Pat Dyer Memorial Fund

ProMedica Hospice Memorial Fund, formerly Heartland Hospice Memorial Fund, and Heartland Home Health & Hospice Serving Northeast Indiana recently presented the Pat Dyer Memorial Fund with a $1,000 check.

The Pat Dyer Memorial Fund donates gas cards to patients seeking IV chemotherapies. Due to COVID-19, they were unable to hold their normal fundraisers to raise money for the gas cards. This foundation began after Pat Dyer passed away from cancer and her husband, Bud, formed the memorial fund to provide some financial relief to patients after recognizing that cancer patients couldn’t make it to chemotherapy treatments due to the financial distress of driving.

Heartland Home Health and Hospice has the honor of caring for cancer patients throughout all stages of their journeys and wanted to show this foundation appreciation on their compassionate impact. 

To watch the video, click here.

testimonials.quoteTitle: HEARTLAND HOME HEALTH CARE SERVING WEST MICHIGAN NAMED A TOP AGENCY OF THE 2019 ABILITY HOMECARE ELITE
testimonials.quote: Heartland Home Health Care Serving West Michigan announced that it has been named a Top Agency of the 2019 HomeCare Elite®, a recognition of the top-performing home health agencies in the United States.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Heartland Home Health Serving West Michigan Named a Top Agency of the 2019 ABILITY HomeCare Elite

Heartland Home Health Care Serving West Michigan announced that it has been named a Top Agency of the 2019 HomeCare Elite®, a recognition of the top-performing home health agencies in the United States. For 14 years, HomeCare Elite has annually identified the top 25 percent of Medicare-certified agencies and highlighted the top 100 and top 500 agencies overall.

The ranking is developed by ABILITY® Network, a leading information technology company helping providers and payers simplify the administrative and clinical complexities of healthcare. It is sponsored by DecisionHealth, part of the H3.Group.

“We’re pleased to recognize Heartland Home Health Care for exemplifying best practice in patient care,” said Christine Lang, senior director for ABILITY Network. “Heartland’s home health professionals have demonstrated exceptional commitment to care quality and the patient experience.”

Shannon Bailey, RN, Administrator, credits timely initiation of care, effective communication with patients and communication with the medical community as a whole with the agency’s ability to achieve recognition as one of the HomeCare Elite. “I am very proud of our team for receiving this award five years in a row. We remain dedicated to making sure our processes are effective and are collaborating with our community partners to reach the best possible outcomes for our patients,” said Shannon.

“Congratulations to Heartland Home Health Care from all of the staff at DecisionHealth,” said Marci Geipe, product manager for Decision Health. “Your leadership and staff have placed a premium on the patient care your agency provides as showcased by your quality outcome scores. The entire community benefits from the compassion that your staff shows toward your patients, leading to cost savings for the entire healthcare system.”

HomeCare Elite agencies are determined by an analysis of performance measures in quality outcomes, best practices implementation, patient experience (HHCAHPS), quality improvement and consistency, and financial health. In order to be considered, an agency must be Medicare-certified and have data for at least three outcomes in Home Health Compare. The entire list of 2019 HomeCare Elite agencies can be downloaded by visiting the ABILITY Network website.

testimonials.quoteTitle: HEARTLAND HOME HEALTH & HOSPICE RECEIVES MASK DONATION FROM WISCONSIN FACE MASK WARRIORS
testimonials.quote: Heartland Home Health and Hospice Serving Northeastern Wisconsin recently received a donation of face masks from Wisconsin Face Mask Warriors. Part of a 50-state network, Wisconsin Face Mask Warriors connects those in need of face masks during the COVID-19 pandemic and community members who sew and donate hand-made, non-medical grade face masks for the most vulnerable.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Heartland Home Health & Hospice Receives Mask Donation from Wisconsin Face Mask Warriors

Heartland Home Health and Hospice Serving Northeastern Wisconsin recently received a donation of face masks from Wisconsin Face Mask Warriors.

Part of a 50-state network, Wisconsin Face Mask Warriors connects those in need of face masks during the COVID-19 pandemic and community members who sew and donate hand-made, non-medical grade face masks for the most vulnerable. All over Wisconsin people are buying fabric, sewing and donating masks for health care workers, skilled nursing and assisted living facilities, hospitals and the military.

According to Melissa Shea, Heartland Hospice Bereavement Coordinator, this is a well-organized endeavor which includes mask drop off and delivery. “It’s quite an amazing group, which is being led by my friend Liz. She started the group and has been expediting since March,” said Melissa.

Local volunteer, Jeni Klein, made and donated 50 cloth masks for the Heartland team. “I started making masks because I have seen first-hand how devastating viral infections like COVID-19 can be to the individuals they infect,” said Jeni. “I am honored to be able to help our community stay healthy. If even one life can be saved from my masks, it is worth it.”

“We will be wearing the masks while in the office and while with patients and their families to maintain infection control,” said Melissa. “I feel honored to have been provided masks and it is so refreshing to know that there are others willing to donate their time to keeping our staff and patients safe,” she said.

testimonials.quoteTitle: HEARTLAND HOME HEALTH CARE HELPS PATIENT GET BACK ON FEET AFTER SURGERY
testimonials.quote: Heartland Home Health serving Northeastern Wisconsin was able to meet the needs of a home health patient who initially declined home health services after her total knee replacement surgery. See how their compassionate care helped this patient get back on her feet.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Heartland Home Health Care Helps Patient Get Back on Feet After Surgery

Heartland Home Health serving Northeastern Wisconsin was able to meet the needs of a home health patient who initially declined home health services after her total knee replacement surgery. Read below to see how their compassionate care helped this patient to get back on her feet.

Following her total knee replacement surgery, the patient stayed in a skilled nursing facility for three nights. The facility offered her an additional stay for one more day to help with her recovery but she declined. Prior to her discharge that Friday, she cancelled her home health services because she didn’t think she needed them.

After being home for a weekend, the director of the surgery center placed a courtesy call to the patient to check on her recovery. The director discovered that the patient was sitting in her tub on her shower chair crying. She explained that it was very difficult to get into the tub and that she didn’t have the energy or stamina to do so. Her husband was at home with her but he felt overwhelmed and wanted additional support. At this point, the patient was requesting to be placed back at the skilled nursing facility because she felt there were no other options for the level of care needed. She asked about her home layout which prompted the director to make a referral for the patient for occupational therapy.

Upon referral, Heartland Home Health immediately started services for the patient by sending a registered nurse to assess her condition. She agreed to start physical therapy the next day. The patient now had daily support between the nurse, physical therapist and occupational therapist. After one week, the patient started to show significant signs of improvement. She was able to move around easier and cope much better. She wasn’t quite ready to attempt a shower so the occupational therapist backed her shower chair up to the tub so she could sit and get her hair washed.

The patient was discharged from home health services with a plan to begin outpatient rehab services the following week. She was very thankful for the tremendous support from Heartland that helped her gain the confidence to move around. She admitted that once home, she was overwhelmed and in a great deal of pain. She reached the point of wanting to give up. With the additional support from Heartland Home Health Care, she was able to move around, bend her knee and get dressed. She was even smiling again!

testimonials.quoteTitle: HOME HEALTH CARE THERAPISTS FACILITATE INCREDIBLE JOURNEY
testimonials.quote: His physical therapist, Dale, was determined to get Mr. E out of his power chair and walking before the first hint of spring in Cleveland. Mr. E’s own goal was to be able to leave his home and eat at a restaurant under his own power. Dale made Mr. E’s goal his own goal, and together the two began an incredible journey.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Home Health Care Therapists Facilitate Incredible Journey

“You can’t imagine what it felt like to wake up in the ICU and not know where you are, what happened, and then realize that you can’t move.” While visiting his family, Mr. E had fallen down steps and sustained a spinal cord injury, a devastating injury he was unable to recall. After a long hospital stay, Mr. E was discharged from a long-term rehab facility and referred to Heartland Home Health Care Serving Northeast Ohio.

His physical therapist, Dale, was determined to get Mr. E out of his power chair and walking before the first hint of spring in Cleveland. Mr. E’s own goal was to be able to leave his home and eat at a restaurant under his own power. Dale made Mr. E’s goal his own goal, and together the two began an incredible journey.

The first step was to get Mr. E out of his chair and walking independently with a walker. Dale soon realized that underneath all that determination, Mr. E was terrified of falling. So Dale worked with Mr. E on controlled falls in a safe environment and the steps to take to get back up. Once Mr. E felt more in control, they worked on strength training and balance activities, and tackled obstacles such as navigating his home, climbing steps and getting in and out of bed. Each new success was another victory and, eventually, Dale was able to transition Mr. E to a walker.

Heidi, Mr. E’s occupational therapist, helps patients regain their ability to do small, but important tasks to be more independent in their daily lives. At the start, Mr. E was completely dependent on others for food preparation, dressing and basic hygiene responsibilities. But with Heidi’s help, he is now able to make his own lunch, dress himself and manage his own hygiene.

Dale and Heidi worked with Mr. E every week until April. To celebrate all of his accomplishments, the Heartland team took Mr. E to his favorite pizzeria. He was able to exit his home, safely get into a car and walk into the pizzeria on his own using his walker, accomplishing the goals he and his therapists had strived for.

testimonials.quoteTitle: MAINTAINING INDEPENDENCE THROUGH HEARTLAND HOME HEALTH CARE
testimonials.quote: “How will I care for myself?” “Will I be able to stay in my own home?” “Who will provide the assistance I need?” Through Heartland Home Health Care, patients can get the care they need to stay independent. Heartland Home Health Serving Western Pennsylvania’s physical and occupational therapists take great care of their 90-year-old patient to make him safe and comfortable in his home.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Maintaining Independence through Heartland Home Health Care

“How will I care for myself?” “Will I be able to stay in my own home?” “Who will provide the assistance I need?” Through Heartland Home Health Care, patients can get the care they need to stay independent.  Heartland Home Health Serving Western Pennsylvania’s physical and occupational therapists take great care of their 90-year-old patient to make him safe and comfortable in his home.

“We have a patient who is 90 years old and lives alone in the city of Pittsburgh. He is very motivated to take care of himself and cooks multiple times per day. Susanne, Occupational Therapist, noticed that when he cooks items, he would often burn them due to forgetfulness. She also was concerned he would leave something on the stove and possibly start a fire. “Susanne could have simply recommended he purchase a timer, but she actually went and purchased an inexpensive timer for him, to help him avoid burning his food and to reduce the risk of any type of a fire. She also used duct tape to tape down cords that were stretched across his pathways, which were tripping hazards for him. She also assisted with his medication management, making it easier and simpler for him to correctly take the medication at the right times. “Jeff, our Physical Therapist, observed the same patient venting frustration at his medical bills, which didn’t include an “S” at the end of his last name. He said this has been an ongoing problem since he turned age 65: 25 years ago. Jeff asked to look at his Medicare card and noticed that the Medicare card was spelled incorrectly, yet his Social Security card had the correct spelling. Jeff then called both Medicare and Social Security offices and coordinated with them to change the patient’s name to be spelled correctly on his Medicare card. Medicare was sending out a corrected card within a month! This way the patient will no longer have the frustrating situation of medical bills with an incorrect last name. “The patient was extremely pleased with both of these clinicians’ extra efforts in assisting him. He stated “Susanne gave me the best gift ever, that timer! I love it and it helps me to not burn my bacon!”

testimonials.quoteTitle: HOME HEALTH AND HOSPICE AGENCY AND SKILLED NURSING FACILITY PARTNER AT LOCAL EVENT TO CELEBRATE NEW NAME
testimonials.quote: ProMedica Home Health and Hospice Serving Central Ohio and ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (Westerville) recently attended a community pep rally at The Avalon of New Albany to engage with the community about the continuum of care that ProMedica provides.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Home Health and Hospice Agency and Skilled Nursing Facility Partner at Local Event to Celebrate New Name

ProMedica Home Health and Hospice Serving Central Ohio and ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (Westerville) recently attended a community pep rally at The Avalon of New Albany to engage with the community about the continuum of care that ProMedica provides. It was a fun event, filled with music, food trucks, a bounce house, a bonfire and a raffle. Residents, community members, colleagues from other healthcare organizations, as well as team members from both the agency and facility attended the event.

When asked about the purpose of the event, Katie Brown, senior account liaison at ProMedica Home Health and Hospice, shared, “It is important to collaborate because ProMedica offers a continuity of care with creative solutions to meet patients and families in their healthcare journey.”

This event provided an opportunity to share the continuum of care in the Central Ohio area and allowed the teams to engage with their community in a creative way. Even Brutus, The Ohio State University mascot, attended!

testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Words of Appreciation for Heartland Home Health Care of Milwaukee

I’m a patient with Heartland Home Health Care in Milwaukee, and I am so happy that I am. I had a feeding tube that I was told I would have for five months, but had it for just two months. My therapist, Julie, has been so helpful and encouraging. Julie has done a very, very good job. I am 95 years old, very independent and live alone. My family doesn't have to worry about me. I could call Heartland 24/7 and I will always get an answer. You don't know what a comfort that is!

testimonials.quoteTitle: HOME HEALTH CARE THERAPISTS FACILITATE INCREDIBLE JOURNEY
testimonials.quote: His physical therapist, Dale, was determined to get Mr. E out of his power chair and walking before the first hint of spring in Cleveland. Mr. E’s own goal was to be able to leave his home and eat at a restaurant under his own power. Dale made Mr. E’s goal his own goal, and together the two began an incredible journey.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Home Health Care Therapists Facilitate Incredible Journey

“You can’t imagine what it felt like to wake up in the ICU and not know where you are, what happened, and then realize that you can’t move.” While visiting his family, Mr. E had fallen down steps and sustained a spinal cord injury, a devastating injury he was unable to recall. After a long hospital stay, Mr. E was discharged from a long-term rehab facility and referred to Heartland Home Health Care Serving Northeast Ohio.

His physical therapist, Dale, was determined to get Mr. E out of his power chair and walking before the first hint of spring in Cleveland. Mr. E’s own goal was to be able to leave his home and eat at a restaurant under his own power. Dale made Mr. E’s goal his own goal, and together the two began an incredible journey.

The first step was to get Mr. E out of his chair and walking independently with a walker. Dale soon realized that underneath all that determination, Mr. E was terrified of falling. So Dale worked with Mr. E on controlled falls in a safe environment and the steps to take to get back up. Once Mr. E felt more in control, they worked on strength training and balance activities, and tackled obstacles such as navigating his home, climbing steps and getting in and out of bed. Each new success was another victory and, eventually, Dale was able to transition Mr. E to a walker.

Heidi, Mr. E’s occupational therapist, helps patients regain their ability to do small, but important tasks to be more independent in their daily lives. At the start, Mr. E was completely dependent on others for food preparation, dressing and basic hygiene responsibilities. But with Heidi’s help, he is now able to make his own lunch, dress himself and manage his own hygiene.

Dale and Heidi worked with Mr. E every week until April. To celebrate all of his accomplishments, the Heartland team took Mr. E to his favorite pizzeria. He was able to exit his home, safely get into a car and walk into the pizzeria on his own using his walker, accomplishing the goals he and his therapists had strived for.

testimonials.quoteTitle: MAINTAINING INDEPENDENCE THROUGH HEARTLAND HOME HEALTH CARE
testimonials.quote: “How will I care for myself?” “Will I be able to stay in my own home?” “Who will provide the assistance I need?” Through Heartland Home Health Care, patients can get the care they need to stay independent. Heartland Home Health Serving Western Pennsylvania’s physical and occupational therapists take great care of their 90-year-old patient to make him safe and comfortable in his home.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Maintaining Independence through Heartland Home Health Care

“How will I care for myself?” “Will I be able to stay in my own home?” “Who will provide the assistance I need?” Through Heartland Home Health Care, patients can get the care they need to stay independent.  Heartland Home Health Serving Western Pennsylvania’s physical and occupational therapists take great care of their 90-year-old patient to make him safe and comfortable in his home.

“We have a patient who is 90 years old and lives alone in the city of Pittsburgh. He is very motivated to take care of himself and cooks multiple times per day. Susanne, Occupational Therapist, noticed that when he cooks items, he would often burn them due to forgetfulness. She also was concerned he would leave something on the stove and possibly start a fire. “Susanne could have simply recommended he purchase a timer, but she actually went and purchased an inexpensive timer for him, to help him avoid burning his food and to reduce the risk of any type of a fire. She also used duct tape to tape down cords that were stretched across his pathways, which were tripping hazards for him. She also assisted with his medication management, making it easier and simpler for him to correctly take the medication at the right times. “Jeff, our Physical Therapist, observed the same patient venting frustration at his medical bills, which didn’t include an “S” at the end of his last name. He said this has been an ongoing problem since he turned age 65: 25 years ago. Jeff asked to look at his Medicare card and noticed that the Medicare card was spelled incorrectly, yet his Social Security card had the correct spelling. Jeff then called both Medicare and Social Security offices and coordinated with them to change the patient’s name to be spelled correctly on his Medicare card. Medicare was sending out a corrected card within a month! This way the patient will no longer have the frustrating situation of medical bills with an incorrect last name. “The patient was extremely pleased with both of these clinicians’ extra efforts in assisting him. He stated “Susanne gave me the best gift ever, that timer! I love it and it helps me to not burn my bacon!”

testimonials.quoteTitle: HEARTLAND HOME HEALTH CARE ADMINISTRATOR HONORS AND THANKS NURSES DURING NURSES WEEK
testimonials.quote: Tara Magruda, Administrator for Heartland Home Health Care Serving Western Pennsylvania, sent out a heartfelt letter to her team of nurses for National Nurses Week.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Heartland Home Health Care Administrator Honors and Thanks Nurses During Nurses Week

Tara Magruda, Administrator for Heartland Home Health Care Serving Western Pennsylvania (Pittsburgh, PA), sent out a heartfelt letter to her team of nurses for National Nurses Week. Tara said, “I send thank you cards to my staff each year to celebrate during Nurses Week. This year has had a different feeling for me. I’ve been in awe watching the bravery of the nurses throughout our country and my own team as they go out and face uncertainty of what they may encounter each day. We began referencing the ‘Nightingale Pledge’ and the meaning it has to all of us. That also caused me to reflect on my reasoning for becoming a nurse and how the experience of being a nurse has changed my life. I started writing the letter from my heart to show what being a nurse has meant to me and how much respect I have for each of them and what they do every day. The job is a difficult one, but so very worth it!” Read Tara’s letter below:

To each of my fellow nurses as we celebrate Nurses Week:  

This year is particularly special to me. At this very difficult time in our nation and across the world, I’m especially proud of our profession. I’ve been reflecting about becoming a nurse so many years ago; the excitement of earning my pin, then cap and finally graduating. At graduation, all of the nurses recited the “Nightingale Pledge” with our class. We promised before God to practice our profession faithfully for those committed to our care. 

Could any of us have known then the impact of that very devotion to our lives? Many of us nurses feel “called” to the profession to help others and to make a positive impact in the world. What we don’t anticipate is the impact it will have on our own lives and that being a nurse will forever change us. It will build our memories, color our views, break our hearts, challenge us, grow us, lift us or flatten us.

At this difficult time in our nation and across the world, I’m so very proud of our profession and humbled to be part of it. As nurses stand, we’re an integral part of the health care team at the front line against this deadly pandemic, doing it with professionalism, selflessness, compassion and sacrifice. While not new to us, these qualities find themselves on full display exactly when our grateful nation needs to see them most. These are just the everyday qualities of a nurse.  Yes…we were “called”. Yes…we do make a difference. We didn’t/couldn’t have known what nursing held for us, but we did know, even then, what we had to give.

Thank you to all of you. In honor of National Nurses Week, please celebrate our profession with pride. Please celebrate knowing for sure that you really do make a difference in a profession that gets back as much as it gives.

Thank you!

Tara

testimonials.quoteTitle: HOME HEALTH AND HOSPICE ADMINISTRATOR RECEIVES LOCAL HEALTH CARE HERO AWARD
testimonials.quote: Susan Ward, Administrator for Heartland Home Health and Hospice serving Shawnee, was one of the 43 people honored as a Health Care Hero by The Journal Record.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Home Health and Hospice Administrator Receives Local Health Care Hero Award

Susan Ward, Administrator for Heartland Home Health and Hospice serving Shawnee, was one of the 43 people honored as a Health Care Hero by The Journal Record. “Our heroes share a common passion for the services they provide and for the life-changing impacts they have on the lives of others,” said Journal Record Editor Russell Ray. “These heroes exemplify what it means to truly care about people, whether they be individuals suffering from a debilitating disease or grieving after a mass tragedy.”

Susan has over 40 years of experience in healthcare and started out her career as a nurse. She has been with Heartland Home Health and Hospice since 2003. To read more about Susan and the award, click the links below.

The Journal Record - Health Care Heroes Honored at Event

The Journal Record - About the Health Care Heroes

testimonials.quoteTitle: WORDS OF APPRECIATION FOR HEARTLAND HOME HEALTH CARE OF SHAWNEE
testimonials.quote: "You have an outstanding company, one I will recommend to other people."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Words of Appreciation for Heartland Home Health Care of Shawnee (1)

My name is JJ, and a few weeks ago I chose Heartland for home health rehab for a knee revision surgery. The reason I chose your company is the physical therapist, Christine, was highly recommended to me. After some research, I found she worked for your company. I have had eight physical therapists in my life before.
She explained what exercises we did and why, and she pushed me when I needed pushed, but never past my limit. I have not had someone this good before. I am so glad she was recommended. The nurse you sent, Kristin, was very professional and polite. She knew her job and did it very well. We liked her and felt very comfortable with her as well. Zack came out twice; very professional, polite, knew his job and did it very well.
Your company is VERY lucky to have outstanding, dedicated employees like these three!!! I feel if all your employees are half this good, you have an outstanding company, one I will recommend to other people. Thank you for the great job they did for me.

testimonials.quoteTitle: WORDS OF APPRECIATION FOR HEARTLAND HOME HEALTH CARE OF SHAWNEE
testimonials.quote: "They have accomplished a complete 180: she is getting her strength back and doing great."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Words of Appreciation for Heartland Home Health Care of Shawnee

Good afternoon. My name is Lisa, and I was just calling to let you know that my mother-in-law is being cared for by Heartland Home Health Care out of Shawnee, Oklahoma. They are doing an extraordinarily wonderful job with her. They have accomplished a complete 180: she is getting her strength back and doing great. They’re providing home health care, PT and OT for her, and I just wanted to thank you guys, and I really want you to pass that along to the folks who are working with her.
Jennifer is one of her therapists, and she and another whose name I don’t know are doing an outstanding job. I just wanted to let you know that. I am so appreciative, and if we can be of any help, if you guys need anything from us, my husband and I are available any time.

testimonials.quoteTitle: PATIENT THANKFUL FOR HOME HEALTH CARE TEAM AFTER SURGERY
testimonials.quote: Luana Renville, who resides at a retirement community in Pratt, Kansas, recently had to undergo a lumbar laminectomy. After surgery, Luana needed physical therapy and nursing, so she reached out to Heartland Home Health Serving Wichita to help with these needs.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Patient Thankful for Home Health Care Team After Surgery

Luana Renville, who resides at a retirement community in Pratt, Kansas, recently had to undergo a lumbar laminectomy. After surgery, Luana needed physical therapy and nursing, so she reached out to Heartland Home Health Serving Wichita to help with these needs.

"I really like all of the nurses. Everyone has great personalities and have been very nice. They are all just so attentive and meet my needs every time, specially the physical therapist, Jesus. Heartland’s care team made my recovery so much easier. If I know anyone else who is going to have surgery, I will step up and say I know who you need! Heartland Home Health is a great company and whenever I called or needed something, they were right there!" – Luana, Home Health Patient

testimonials.quoteTitle: HUSBAND AND WIFE THANKFUL FOR HEARTLAND HOME HEALTH
testimonials.quote: Every day, Heartland Home Health receives thanks for the care they have provided to a patient or someone’s loved one. The “thank you” messages come from the patient, a family member or loved one, or many times both the patient and a loved one. Below is a wonderful message Heartland Home Health Serving Wichita received from a recent patient, Marsha, and her husband, Jack.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Husband and Wife Thankful for Heartland Home Health

Every day, Heartland Home Health receives thanks for the care they have provided to a patient or someone’s loved one. The “thank you” messages come from the patient, a family member or loved one, or many times both the patient and a loved one. Below is a wonderful message Heartland Home Health Serving Wichita received from a recent patient, Marsha, and her husband, Jack.

“I love Heartland Home Health! They work so well with you as a patient, personally with what you need. I have been working with therapy to strengthen my legs and I feel stronger than I did before. I have worked with Heartland therapists several times. My therapist Bob has been great! Bob left me exercises to continue to work on, and I enjoy working on them. I am also glad I can be up and cooking again. I would definitely recommend Heartland Home Health to others.” - Marsha, Home Health Patient

“I am happy my wife is home with me. Thanks to Heartland Home Health, we are able to be at home together again.” - Jack, Marsha's Husband

testimonials.quoteTitle: A MESSAGE FROM A HEARTLAND HOME HEALTH CARE FAN
testimonials.quote: “These nurses have always taken good care of me. In fact they have saved my life, several times. Heartland Home Health Care is the only company that I want to take care of me!”
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

A Message from a Heartland Home Health Care Fan

“A year and a half ago I was living at my daughter Nancy’s house while I was under the care of Heartland Home Health. Elizabeth, my Heartland nurse, was becoming concerned about my weight as it approached 257 lbs. One day she looked at me and gently explained, ‘Cliff, I understand that you just lost your wife and how difficult that is for you, please remember that you still have your children, grandchildren and great grandchildren who all worship you. I am concerned about your weight. Now we are going to do something about it.’ From that day on, Elizabeth had me keep a daily journal to record everything that I ate, the calories I consumed and any physical activities I’ve done. I write notes and poems in this journal and the Heartland nurses that visit write back giving me suggestions or praises for what I am doing.”

“These nurses have always taken good care of me. In fact they have saved my life, several times. Heartland Home Health care is the only company that I want to take care of me!” One day when Clifford’s blood sugar was low when she arrived, Elizabeth had him eat and checked that his blood sugar returned to normal. As a follow-up later that day, she texted and called Clifford. When he didn’t respond, she returned to the home to find him unconscious, and called EMS. “The doctors said another hour and I would have been gone. These nurses never stop taking care of you 24/7!”

 

Clifford Conway

Heartland Home Health Care Patient, 2016

Vietnam Veteran, Father of 5, Grandfather of 23,

Great grandfather of 24, Great-great grandfather of 5

testimonials.quoteTitle: HOME HEALTH CARE THERAPISTS FACILITATE INCREDIBLE JOURNEY
testimonials.quote: His physical therapist, Dale, was determined to get Mr. E out of his power chair and walking before the first hint of spring in Cleveland. Mr. E’s own goal was to be able to leave his home and eat at a restaurant under his own power. Dale made Mr. E’s goal his own goal, and together the two began an incredible journey.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Home Health Care Therapists Facilitate Incredible Journey

“You can’t imagine what it felt like to wake up in the ICU and not know where you are, what happened, and then realize that you can’t move.” While visiting his family, Mr. E had fallen down steps and sustained a spinal cord injury, a devastating injury he was unable to recall. After a long hospital stay, Mr. E was discharged from a long-term rehab facility and referred to Heartland Home Health Care Serving Northeast Ohio.

His physical therapist, Dale, was determined to get Mr. E out of his power chair and walking before the first hint of spring in Cleveland. Mr. E’s own goal was to be able to leave his home and eat at a restaurant under his own power. Dale made Mr. E’s goal his own goal, and together the two began an incredible journey.

The first step was to get Mr. E out of his chair and walking independently with a walker. Dale soon realized that underneath all that determination, Mr. E was terrified of falling. So Dale worked with Mr. E on controlled falls in a safe environment and the steps to take to get back up. Once Mr. E felt more in control, they worked on strength training and balance activities, and tackled obstacles such as navigating his home, climbing steps and getting in and out of bed. Each new success was another victory and, eventually, Dale was able to transition Mr. E to a walker.

Heidi, Mr. E’s occupational therapist, helps patients regain their ability to do small, but important tasks to be more independent in their daily lives. At the start, Mr. E was completely dependent on others for food preparation, dressing and basic hygiene responsibilities. But with Heidi’s help, he is now able to make his own lunch, dress himself and manage his own hygiene.

Dale and Heidi worked with Mr. E every week until April. To celebrate all of his accomplishments, the Heartland team took Mr. E to his favorite pizzeria. He was able to exit his home, safely get into a car and walk into the pizzeria on his own using his walker, accomplishing the goals he and his therapists had strived for.

testimonials.quoteTitle: MAINTAINING INDEPENDENCE THROUGH HEARTLAND HOME HEALTH CARE
testimonials.quote: “How will I care for myself?” “Will I be able to stay in my own home?” “Who will provide the assistance I need?” Through Heartland Home Health Care, patients can get the care they need to stay independent. Heartland Home Health Serving Western Pennsylvania’s physical and occupational therapists take great care of their 90-year-old patient to make him safe and comfortable in his home.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

Maintaining Independence through Heartland Home Health Care

“How will I care for myself?” “Will I be able to stay in my own home?” “Who will provide the assistance I need?” Through Heartland Home Health Care, patients can get the care they need to stay independent.  Heartland Home Health Serving Western Pennsylvania’s physical and occupational therapists take great care of their 90-year-old patient to make him safe and comfortable in his home.

“We have a patient who is 90 years old and lives alone in the city of Pittsburgh. He is very motivated to take care of himself and cooks multiple times per day. Susanne, Occupational Therapist, noticed that when he cooks items, he would often burn them due to forgetfulness. She also was concerned he would leave something on the stove and possibly start a fire. “Susanne could have simply recommended he purchase a timer, but she actually went and purchased an inexpensive timer for him, to help him avoid burning his food and to reduce the risk of any type of a fire. She also used duct tape to tape down cords that were stretched across his pathways, which were tripping hazards for him. She also assisted with his medication management, making it easier and simpler for him to correctly take the medication at the right times. “Jeff, our Physical Therapist, observed the same patient venting frustration at his medical bills, which didn’t include an “S” at the end of his last name. He said this has been an ongoing problem since he turned age 65: 25 years ago. Jeff asked to look at his Medicare card and noticed that the Medicare card was spelled incorrectly, yet his Social Security card had the correct spelling. Jeff then called both Medicare and Social Security offices and coordinated with them to change the patient’s name to be spelled correctly on his Medicare card. Medicare was sending out a corrected card within a month! This way the patient will no longer have the frustrating situation of medical bills with an incorrect last name. “The patient was extremely pleased with both of these clinicians’ extra efforts in assisting him. He stated “Susanne gave me the best gift ever, that timer! I love it and it helps me to not burn my bacon!”

testimonials.quoteTitle: PROMEDICA HOME HEALTH PATIENT THANKFUL FOR RECOVERY FROM NOVEL CORONAVIRUS
testimonials.quote: Mike Williams, a patient with ProMedica Home Health serving Monroe and Lenawee counties recently recovered from COVID-19 after nearly a month in the hospital and self-quarantining at home.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

ProMedica Home Health Patient Thankful for Recovery from Novel Coronavirus

Mike Williams, a patient with ProMedica Home Health serving Monroe and Lenawee counties recently recovered from COVID-19 after nearly a month in the hospital and self-quarantining at home. Andrea Tocco, RN, Case Manager with ProMedica Home Health, officially discharged Mike as a COVID-19 patient.

“I’m so proud of you,” Andrea said. “You made it. I told you we will get through this together. This was both of our first times doing this.”

On April 5, Mike tested positive for the novel coronavirus and assumed the diagnosis would be his death sentence. After a month of being in the hospital and then at home, it was a surreal moment for Mike to hear that he had recovered. When Mike returned home to self-quarantine, Andrea visited with him weekly to check his vitals.

“A big weight has been lifted,” Mike said. “I don’t ever want to go through something like that again.”

To read more about Mike's story, click here.

testimonials.quoteTitle: PROMEDICA HOME HEALTH RN OPENS UP ABOUT WORKING DURING NOVEL CORONAVIRUS
testimonials.quote: Marie DeLine, Registered Nurse with ProMedica Home Health Serving Monroe and Lenawee Counties, recently shared her experiences over the last couple of weeks, from how caring for patients who have tested positive has made her feel, to how helpful other team members have been during this difficult time.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences

ProMedica Home Health RN Opens Up About Working During Novel Coronavirus

During this difficult time of the novel coronavirus spreading, people being ordered to stay home and many non-essential businesses closing for the time being, there is fear and uncertainty. However, through all the fear and uncertainty, frontline workers put on a brave face and continue to support and care for patients, residents and other community members. But even behind a brave face, many frontline workers are still scared.

Marie DeLine, Registered Nurse with ProMedica Home Health Serving Monroe and Lenawee Counties, recently shared her experiences over the last couple of weeks, from how caring for patients who have tested positive has made her feel, to how helpful other team members have been during this difficult time:

“I was asked to start seeing positive patients about two weeks ago. I was nervous, very nervous. Mary Holtzen, Staff Educator, asked me to come in and worked with me on donning and doffing my PPE until I was comfortable. She even wrote me a card with step-by-step instructions in case I got scared and forgot. She put her number on the bottom and told me to call her if I needed anything.”

“Someone from the telehealth team met me at my first patient’s home and the gentleman walked me through installing the equipment. It went well and my patient couldn't believe the level of care he was going to receive AFTER leaving the hospital. He was scared, but said it made him feel safe knowing he could call us at any time, and someone was going to be checking on him daily.”

“After my first patient, Sara Brown, Manager of Operations, and Brook Broughton, Director of Professional Services, both called me on my way home to see how I was doing. They knew that I was nervous to be seeing positive patients and asked if I needed anything.”

“Today I had three positive patients on my schedule and only had enough PPE for two visits. I called my educator, Mary. She immediately stopped what she was doing to drive all the way from Dundee to downtown Monroe to deliver more PPE to me.”

“I was scared in the beginning, but to be honest, I'm still scared. Seeing patients with a terrible illness that is killing hundreds in my state is not easy. It is constantly on my mind. Am I doing everything to protect myself, my other patients and my own family?”

“Whether I am scared or not, our patients need a nurse when they come home. They have many questions and are very fragile. Many are on oxygen, afraid and don’t know what to do now that they are home. I am glad to be there for support, to be the one to give them confidence and to give them an ear to listen after being so alone in the hospital. My patient cried today because he was so happy that I listened to his story during my visit. He was intubated and alone for weeks and he said he was sure he would never see his family again.”

“I'm scared but my team gives me the emotional support I need to be the best nurse I can be. Checking on me and getting me my equipment as soon as possible… I have all the PPE and support I need to feel safe and do my job. I am VERY THANKFUL.”

“From the bottom of my heart, THANK YOU ALL for being there for me during this difficult time. Mary Holtson, Brook Broughton, Sara Brown, telehealth and all my Monroe team.”

title: ProMedica At Home (Private Duty) - ProMedica Home Health

content.hospiceName: ProMedica At Home Serving Northwest Ohio
content.counties: Defiance, Fulton, Henry, Lucas, Paulding, Putnam, Williams, Wood
content.title: Private Duty Care
content.description: The goal of our private duty care is to enhance our clients’ quality of life and promote independence by providing non-medical and medical home care services. Private duty care is available for clients’ who require care beyond typical health care services. They may include medical and surgical nursing care, home health aides, a homemaker or companion, a medical social worker, and rehabilitation including physical therapy, occupational therapy and speech language pathology.

ourServices.content:
Our Services

We are here to help provide the services you need, such as:

  • Providing companionship
  • Supporting independence through activities of daily living such as meal preparation and moving around the home safely
  • Providing supplemental services after surgery
  • Providing peace of mind after rehabilitation
  • Providing care during an advanced illness or in addition to home health and hospice services
  • Providing care and supervision for the extremely frail, dementia sufferers, or those needing support with functional limitation

HowCanHelp.content:
How Can ProMedica Help?

ProMedica enables clients to continue living as independently as possible with comforting care while providing their families, caregivers and friends with timely client updates and peace of mind. Care can begin at any time, day or night.

Our Private Duty Care includes:

  • An on-site visitation by a Heartland nurse
  • An evaluation of client's needs and environment
  • Identifying of available community resources that could help clients
  • Bathing, dressing, grooming, and other personal care services
  • A medication assessment on new or changed prescriptions
  • A nutritional review and assistance with meal preparation
  • A status report to family, caregiver or guardian
  • Medical social work review, as indicated
  • In-home nursing and therapy services
  • Light housekeeping, and companion care
